heading: intel's date with doom?
subheading: the ftc investigation of the chipmaking giant may end in june. also: geocities plans to go public later this year.... cash flows into thestreet.com.
author: wired news report
text: businessweek online - - - geocities ipo: the company reportedly plans to sell a 10 to 15 percent stake and raise us$40 million to $50 million, putting the company's value between $300 and $500 million, according to an unnamed source in the article. currently, geocities is in the red, and the cash infusion could give it the bucks it needs to forge online alliances and exclusive deals. geocities offers home pages and how-to's free of charge.- - - thestreet.com is rolling in it: thestreet.com, a tell-it-like-it-is, no-frills financial news site that boasts wall street celeb contributors like the ever-quotable james cramer and syndicated columnist herb greenberg, charges a fee for its content and just opened a san francisco bureau.
